name.str_pl: copies of Tales from the Half-Underground

description: A barely discernible handwriting is scribbled all across the pages of this once-majestic tome. It is clear it was once a work of great erudition, yet it is currently barely holding on together. The contents of the book seem to describe some sort of building design, although you aren't sure what exactly.

A barely discernible handwriting is scribbled all across the pages of this once-majestic tome. It is clear it was once a work of great erudition, yet it is currently barely holding on together. The contents of the book seem to provide a comprehensive and exhaustive commentary on the execution of a heretic in 1468.

A barely discernible handwriting is scribbled all across the pages of this once-majestic tome. It is clear it was once a work of great erudition, yet it is currently barely holding on together. The contents of the book seem to discuss the existence of an 'Ashkhan' who was foretold in the 'Book of Impermanence' and whose destiny is to '...wipe the land of the unnatural.'
This leather-bound journal only has a single sentence repeated ad nauseam. 'Four Gods, One Betrayed. Nine Saw, Three Told. Seven Stole, Two Remained. One Killed, One Died.
